message: If it helps, I'm in Israel so with an Israeli time zone
I'm having the following set of bugs (probably related):
in some rooms, new messages arrive and are immediately set a time of "2 minutes ago", even right after I write them
Looking at other rooms, messages from further ago (10 hours) also appear to have a discrepancy (e.g. a reported 10 hours ago message has a tooltip reading "7 hours ago", etc.)
When I look at the "2 minutes ago" tooltip, I see "0 minutes ago". This goes as far back as message from the last hour, which also appear as "0 minutes ago"

I'd guess the time of the message is translated with JavaScript on the clientside to X minutes ago. Now if your PCs time is 2 minutes ahead of the server time. You will always have a discrepancy of 2 minutes. The tool tip could be a bug. I also have a discrepancy between tooltip and message. I'm GMT+1

@adsworth I implemented a similar mechanism, and we calculated the difference between the server and clientside in the javascript to get accurate results. Also, makes dealing with different time zones solely an issue of the client, not the server.
@edanm which means that you can have posts that appear to have been created in the future, but it's the most sensible thing todo if you want continuous updates of the times as convore does.
